title: Fort Scott National Historic Site: Getting Around
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Getting Around              Getting Around       Access to the site's 20 historic structures and five acres of restored tallgrass prairie is by foot. Mobility impaired visitors may use wheelchairs and segways to get around the site, and those with infants and small children may use strollers, but no other wheeled vehicles are allowed on site. For the safety of all our visitors, bicycling and skateboarding are prohibited.  Bicycle riding is permitted in the Bus/RV lot, and can be walked on the site grounds but must be dismounted and attended by the owner. The site may be used for the following recreational purposes: walking, strolling, and jogging..
